arch:property.oc:show_val: Soil

The eighth highest and eighth latest cross-section of fill from the cistern shaft. 0.20 m deep with a Munsell reading of 7.5YR4/4, Brown. These layers were carefully removed with trowels, small shovels, dustpans, and gofahs, and then looked through several times to ensure that all artifactual material was saved.
Loci 23-29, Loci 38-40.
Closing Elevation: 1.34 m below Sub datum SP 84 D or 903.824 m.
XI

Phase X: Site abandonment after major collapse dating to the Byzantine period from the CE 4th to 5th c. New drainage systems are installed including that associated with the newly built west precinct wall.
Stage 3
In cistern shaft (Locus 22) is southwest of SP 84.
Locus 29 cistern fill.
XII
1.10 m in north south diameter-by-1.11 m in east west diameter-by-0.20 m in depth.
Destruction and accumulation of debris.

Phase IX: Major CE 363 earthquake leads to the collapse of large architectural features and the primary deposition of fluvial wash. Debris accumulates in the Shrine Room followed by major collapse. The West Walkway Wall collapses and the Residential Quarter is destroyed.
X
Eighth layer of cistern fill (0.20 m)
IX
Phase XII: Use levels, robbing and abandonments continue. Upper levels of fluvial wash are deposited. Rooms A and B are abandoned.
Locus 38 cistern fill.
Opening Elevation: 1.14 m below Sub Datum SP 84 D or 904.024 m.
Phase XIII: Major collapses continue into the Islamic period.

Phase XI: Further collapse post-CE 5th c., possibly the result of the earthquake of 512. Fill accumulates following the disuse of the canalization systems. The remains of two bodies are found in the upper level fluvial deposits. Localized burning in some areas.
XIII
